results.name: If n = Sum c_i 10^i then a(n) = Sum c_i 2^i.
comment: For n<100, this is the same result as "If n = Sum c_i 10^i then a(n) = Sum c_i (i+1)". - _Henry Bottomley_, Apr 20 2001
n_2 in the notation of A122618.
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
Robin C. Yu, Decibinary Numbers, on Hackerrank.com.
Index entries for sequences related to decimal expansion of n
formula: a(0) = 0, a(n) = 2*a(n/10) if n==0 (mod 10), a(n) = a(n-1)+1 otherwise. - _Benoit Cloitre_, Dec 21 2002
For all n, a(A007088(n)) = n. - _Antti Karttunen_, Jun 22 2014
mathematica: a[n_ /; n < 10] := n; a[n_] := a[n] = If[Mod[n, 10] != 0, a[n-1] + 1, 2*a[n/10]]; Table[a[n], {n, 0, 100}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Apr 02 2016 *)
program: (MIT/GNU Scheme) (define (A028897 n) (let loop ((z 0) (i 0) (n n)) (if (zero? n) z (loop (+ z (* (modulo n 10) (expt 2 i))) (1+ i) (floor->exact (/ n 10)))))) ;; _Antti Karttunen_, Jun 22 2014
a028897 n = 2 * a028897 n' + d where (n', d) = divMod n 10
xref: Differs from A081594 and A244158 for the first time at n=100, which here is a(100) = 4.
See A322000 for integers ordered according to the value of a(n).
